2.text: “If someone ventures to talk with you, will you be grieved? But who can withhold himself from speaking?

3.text: Behold, you have instructed many, you have strengthened the weak hands.

4.text: Your words have supported him who was falling, You have made firm the feeble knees.

5.text: But now it has come to you, and you faint. It touches you, and you are troubled.

6.text: Isn’t your piety your confidence? Isn’t the integrity of your ways your hope?

7.text: “Remember, now, whoever perished, being innocent? Or where were the upright cut off?

8.text: According to what I have seen, those who plow iniquity, and sow trouble, reap the same.

9.text: By the breath of God they perish. By the blast of his anger are they consumed.

10.text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

11.text: The old lion perishes for lack of prey. The cubs of the lioness are scattered abroad.

12.text: “Now a thing was secretly brought to me. My ear received a whisper of it.

13.text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falls on men,

14.text: fear came on me, and trembling, which made all my bones shake.

15.text: Then a spirit passed before my face. The hair of my flesh stood up.

16.text: It stood still, but I couldn’t discern its appearance. A form was before my eyes. Silence, then I heard a voice, saying,

17.text: ‘Shall mortal man be more just than God? Shall a man be more pure than his Maker?

18.text: Behold, he puts no trust in his servants. He charges his angels with error.

19.text: How much more, those who dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, who are crushed before the moth!

20.text: Between morning and evening they are destroyed. They perish forever without any regarding it.

21.text: Isn’t their tent cord plucked up within them? They die, and that without wisdom.’
